title: Why would someone choose to attend a liberal arts college rather than a university? - Quora

response.answer_text: Benefits: You will receive a well rounded education. You will be taught by professors and not TA's. You will be part of a community. Class size will be smaller. Professors will know you by name.Drawbacks: Less research facilities. Sports programs will not be "big-time". Perceived status and reputation will not be as widely recognized. You will have a more limited choice of courses.Amherst, Williams, Swarthmore, Haverford among other top LA colleges are outstanding schools with graduate school acceptance rates equal to any ivy school. One indicator of graduate school acceptance for universities and colleges is the following list of the colleges that produce the most the per capita membership in the following: NAS, National Academy of Science, NAE, Engineering or IOM, Medicine membership, all of which require an advanced degree. Liberal Arts Colleges in bold: The following is the rank of the membership in NAS, NAE, or IOM membership. 1 California Institute of Technology 2 MIT 3 Harvard University 4 Swarthmore College 5 Princeton University 6 Amherst College 7 Yale University 8 University of Chicago 9 Stanford University 10 Haverford College 11 Oberlin College 12	Reed College 13 Columbia University 14 Cooper Union 15 Rice University. So you can see that top LA colleges fair just as well as ivy universities.
